definition: to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]
to shrink back as the time for battle approaches (idiom)/to get cold feet

sentences.english: Even the consequences of glacier retreat are poorly understood.
sentences.chinese: 人們甚至對冰川退縮的後果也不太清楚。

sentences.english: “You don’t have to drop them off, ” Madeleine said, undeterred.
sentences.chinese: “你不用交給別人去洗，”瑪德琳毫不退縮地說。

sentences.english: He doesn't back off, though, when I raise the F-word.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有退縮，不過，當我提出的F字。

sentences.english: Conclusion The gingival recession and the wedge shaped defect are common dental diseases in the elderly.
sentences.chinese: 結論牙齦退縮與楔狀缺損是中老年人常見的牙病。

sentences.english: Do you shrink from doing anything that smacks of self-promotion?
sentences.chinese: 帶有自薦意味的事情會讓你退縮嗎？

sentences.english: In turn scientists have retreated to their 'ivory towers', she said.
sentences.chinese: 她說，反過來，科學家退縮到了他們的“象牙塔”裏。

sentences.english: Mr Obama has not flinched so far.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬到目前爲止都沒有退縮。

sentences.english: Thy sovranty , recoiling with a blow.
sentences.chinese: 因突遭一擊而退縮隱忍。

sentences.english: Ice on the Qinghai plateau is retreating at the rate of seven per cent every year.
sentences.chinese: 青海高原上的冰川正以每年7%的速率退縮。

sentences.english: Claire canceled the wedding. She got cold feet.
sentences.chinese: 克萊兒取消婚禮，她臨陣退縮。

sentences.english: His retraction predicates a change of attitude.
sentences.chinese: 他的退縮表示他態度有了變化。

sentences.english: He said he was competitive and feisty and he did not back down.
sentences.chinese: 他說他很有競爭力，很好強，而且不退縮。

sentences.english: The crowd drew back as the tank approached.
sentences.chinese: 當坦克靠近時，這羣人就往後退縮。

sentences.english: In face of difficulties, we should not cower but meet them bravely.
sentences.chinese: 面臨困難時我們不應該退縮，而應該勇敢地面對。

sentences.english: A large majority of glaciers are in retreat, defined as the shifting of the snout.
sentences.chinese: 從冰川鼻移動的定義出發，大部分冰川都在退縮。

sentences.english: This time, instead of recoiling , Jessika hugged him back.
sentences.chinese: 這一次，傑西卡不再退縮，而是主動回哥哥一個擁抱。

definition: but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to be defeated/to lose/to fail (e.g. experiments)/failure/defeat/CL:次[ci4]
to thwart/to foil (sb's plans)/a setback/a failure/a defeat
